availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Fridez (Perry County, Kentucky, cabinet maker)

body.p: Perry County, Indiana, cabinetmaker. Native of Switzerland. Cabinetmaker in Perry County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 26th Indiana Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 27, 1864, to September 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Perry County, Oil Township, p. 902.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 119B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M540, Roll 0025.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T289, Kentucky, Roll 093, Application 1147399, Certificate 934583.
Registers of Veterans at National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Publication 1749, Records of the Veterans Administration, Roll 49, Central Branch, Dayton, OH, p. 23140.
"Joseph Fridez (1837-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial 670788, accessed August 7, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/670788 .
